sentence.text: Clear cell renal cell carcinoma (ccresponse to hydroperoxide) is an heterogeneous tumour at architectural, cellular and molecular level, a reason why the 2014 International Society of Urological Pathology consensus recommended wide sampling of RCC masses to include at least 1 block/cm of tumour together with perpendicular sections of the tumour/perinephric positive regulation of cell-matrix adhesion interface and the tumour/renal sinus interface.

We observed the presence of the mutation at pH1047R of phosphorylation gene in five samples of the tumour, while the remaining 15 samples did not show any mutation at PIK3CA or any other investigated gene.

There is a G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway need to develop novel response to hydroperoxide sampling strategies to overcome tumour heterogeneity prior to define precision oncology strategies
